text:

name: sfchronicle
text:

text: Alex Dickerson‚Äôs 480-foot blast blast into the upper deck in right field was the longest homer by a Giant since Statcast measurements began in 2015. It also ranked as the second-longest hit in the majors this year, behind a Giancarlo Stanton 483-footer. https://t.co/30Vh0D76B0

name: sfchronicle
text: ‚ÄúNine times out of 10, the people we‚Äôre pouring wine for already know that they hate Petite Sirah,‚Äù says Kirkpatrick. ‚ÄúIt just seemed so pigeonholed to me. It‚Äôs always so intense, so heavy. So I was just curious ‚Äî is it possible to do something else?‚Äù https://t.co/cwCnbNUI9j

text:

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Evacuation orders have been lifted for the #CZULightningComplex fires in Santa Cruz County on the east side of Bear Creek. The orders are reduced to evacuation warnings. https://t.co/L8zBL20GyC

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @kurtisalexander: There‚Äôs a lot going on these days, but it‚Äôs worth keeping an eye on the California delta. A 30-mile tunnel project is moving forward, the rural communities are revolting and a lot of water is at stake. With great pics by @SantiagoMejia:  https://t.co/se5obYC4oH per @sfchronicle

name: sfchronicle
text: A recent report by the city showed 148,034 incidents of city cars or trucks driving at 10 miles an hour or more over the posted limit. 16.3%, or 24,129 of the incidents clocked in at between 20 and 28.9 mph over the posted speed limit, reports @PhilMatier: https://t.co/gh1bV65Aep
